proper noun.description: The capital of West Virginia, in the southwestern part of the state; population 50,302 (est. 2008).
A city and port in South Carolina; population 111,978 (est. 2008). The bombardment of Fort Sumter in 1861 by Confederate troops marked the beginning of the Civil War.

noun.description: A lively dance of the 1920s that involved turning the knees inward and kicking out the lower legs.

origin: 1920s: named after Charleston in South Carolina, US.
